security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill definition file with no executable code. The skill provides documentation-based guidance for bug diagnosis workflows. No network calls, no script execution, no file system access beyond its own definition, and no command execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Diagnose bugs and find root causes
content.value_statement: Software bugs waste hours of developer time. This skill provides systematic root cause analysis, identifying exactly where and why errors occur. It delivers detailed diagnostic reports with specific code locations, step-by-step fix instructions, and multiple solution options.
actual_capabilities: Analyze error messages and stack traces to identify problem sources
Review code using Read, Grep, and Glob tools to locate buggy sections
Run diagnostic commands like git log and npm list to investigate issues
Provide detailed fix solutions with exact file paths and line numbers
Document root causes with technical explanations and code references
Offer multiple solution options with pros and cons analysis
limitations: Does not directly modify code - only provides guidance
Cannot access external systems or APIs for debugging
Relies on user-provided error context and reproduction steps

use_cases.title: Fix runtime errors
use_cases.description: Diagnose application crashes and runtime exceptions with precise code location identification

use_cases.title: Investigate test failures
use_cases.description: Analyze test failures to determine if they are code bugs or environmental issues

use_cases.title: Debug deployment issues
use_cases.description: Identify root causes of build failures and deployment problems in CI/CD pipelines

prompt_templates.title: Quick error check
prompt_templates.prompt: I got this error: [paste error message]. Help me understand what caused it and how to fix it.

prompt_templates.title: Debug failing test
prompt_templates.prompt: My test [test name] is failing with: [error details]. The test file is at [path]. Review the test and source code to find the root cause.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze production bug
prompt_templates.prompt: Production is showing [symptom]. Error logs indicate: [logs]. The relevant code is in [files]. Find the root cause and suggest a fix.

prompt_templates.title: Complex debugging
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a bug where [description]. It happens when [reproduction steps]. I checked [already-tried fixes]. Use git blame to check recent changes and help identify what caused this regression.

output_examples.input: My React app crashes with 'Cannot read property map of undefined' when I click the submit button
output: Problem: Data fetching returns undefined before component renders
Root cause: The async data load completes after initial render
Fix: Add conditional rendering check before accessing data
Step 1: Check if data exists before calling .map()
Verify: Run app and test submit button functionality

best_practices: Provide complete error messages including stack traces for faster diagnosis
Include the exact steps to reproduce the bug
Share relevant file paths and recent code changes
anti_patterns: Asking for fixes without sharing error details
Expecting the skill to modify code directly
Skipping the diagnosis phase and asking only for solutions

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Use it when you see error messages, crashes, or unexpected behavior.

faq.question: What information should I provide for best results?
faq.answer: Share the full error message, stack trace, reproduction steps, and relevant code snippets. More context leads to faster diagnosis.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides detailed guidance and solution steps. You apply the fixes yourself to maintain control over your codebase.

faq.question: Is my code data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All analysis happens within your AI tool session. Code is processed locally and never sent to external servers.

faq.question: Can this handle performance issues?
faq.answer: Yes. Include performance metrics, slow function names, and profiling data. The skill can identify bottlenecks and optimization opportunities.

faq.question: How is this different from general debugging?
faq.answer: This skill follows a systematic four-step process: information gathering, code review, root cause analysis, and solution planning. It provides detailed reports you can directly act on.
